message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the nature of stars and their distance from Earth. Stars are extremely far away from us, and even though they may appear bright and glowing, they are actually much farther than they seem. Option (B) is incorrect because stars are not close to us. Option (C) is incorrect because stars are not touchable objects. Option (D) is incorrect because stars are not near to us.

This question requires basic knowledge about the nature of stars. Stars, despite appearing bright and glowing, are actually very distant from us. Option (B) is incorrect because if the stars were close, they would not be as tiny and distant as they appear. Option (C) is incorrect because stars are not physically touchable due to their distance from us. Option (D) is incorrect because if the stars were near, they would not appear as small and far away as they do.

Option (A) is correct because stars are extremely far away from Earth, so even though they may appear bright and glowing, they are still very distant. Option (D) is incorrect because "near" is a subjective term and not a precise measurement of distance.
